title: Download APKs from Google Play: A Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Sign in to the Play Store on your computer.
steps.content: Sign in to the Play Store on your computer. One way to download an APK file for a Play Store app is to use an APK downloader tool like APKCombo. Start by going to https://play.google.com in your computer's web browser and signing in with your Google account. Once you download an APK file for a Play Store app with this method, you can easily transfer it to your Android. You can only download APKs for free apps —it's not possible to get a paid app's APK.

steps.title: Go to the app you want to download.
steps.content: Go to the app you want to download. To search for an app, type its name into the Search bar and press your keyboard's Enter key. When you find the app, click its name to open its details page.

steps.title: Copy the URL from your browser's address bar.
steps.content: Copy the URL from your browser's address bar. Click the address bar, then press Ctrl + C (PC) or Cmd + C (Mac) to copy it.

steps.title: Go to APKCombo's website and click App Downloader.
steps.content: Go to APKCombo's website and click App Downloader . You'll see this link at the top of the site. Alternatively, you can use a different APK downloader website. The steps will be very similar regardless of your chosen APK downloading site. A quick Google search will provide a wide selection of third-party APK downloaders.

steps.title: Paste the Play Store link.
steps.content: Paste the Play Store link. To do this, right-click or Ctrl + click the "Name or Package Name or Play Store URL" field and select Paste .

steps.title: Choose a configuration and click Generate Download Link.
steps.content: Choose a configuration and click Generate Download Link . If you want to download an APK file from the Play Store for a specific device, architecture, or Android version, you can choose your preferred options from the menus before downloading. This locates the app you want to download and generates a link for saving the APK file.

steps.title: Click the download icon next to the APK.
steps.content: Click the download icon next to the APK. The icon looks like a downward-pointing arrow above a horizontal line. This saves the selected app's APK to your computer. You can now transfer the file to your Android from your Windows PC or Mac .

steps.title: Install App APK Extractor & Analyzer.
steps.content: Install App APK Extractor & Analyzer. Although you can't download an app's APK directly from the Play Store, you can extract and generate an APK from any Play Store app using App APK Extractor & Analyzer . Just search for app apk extractor in the Play Store—the app was developed by Yasiru Nayanajith.

steps.title: Download the Play Store app you want as an APK.
steps.content: Download the Play Store app you want as an APK. For example, if you want to have an APK of Snapchat, download Snapchat on your Android.

steps.title: Open App APK Extractor & Analyzer and select an app.
steps.content: Open App APK Extractor & Analyzer and select an app. When you launch App APK Extractor & Analyzer, you'll see a list of apps on your Android. You can filter the list by User , System , or All to find the app you're looking for. Once you tap the app, a pop-up will appear.

steps.title: Tap Extract App.
steps.content: Tap Extract App . This generates an APK file name and prompts you to save it to your Android.

steps.title: Select a saving location and tap Save.
steps.content: Select a saving location and tap Save . This saves the APK of the selected Play Store app to your Android.
